Posts.Content: SuzyWillKickThis wrote: I can't see a thread yet! I'm starting chemo either on 30th September or 2nd October, and am getting a PICC line in on Thursday as my veins are crap! It would be great to have some people to go through it with- we could hold each other's hands! I'm Suzy, aged 32 and live in Northern Ireland. My partner is called Ian and we've been together for 12 1/2 years. We have two kids, Ricky, aged 3, and Robbie, aged 16 months. I've just had a bilateral lumpectomy a month ago, and will be having six rounds of chemo followed by radio. The first three rounds of chemo will be FEC- arghhh...the bumph about it is in my car, I'll lift it out in a while and give you the actual drug names, lol! I hope there might be some others out there- not that I will be happy about your situation, but will be happy if we can give each other some support. Dx 7/29/2008, 2cm, Stage IIa??, Grade 3, 5/17 nodes, ER-/PR-/HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: SuzyWillKickThis wrote: I'm so confused! I have a picc line in and started chemo yesterday. I keep reading about ports and piccs, and have realised that they are (apparently) totally different things. The ports sound a lot more invasive than piccs- why are they used? What are the differences between them? I read TNT's very useful thread on getting her port installed. A lot of us who are just starting down this road are completely clueless about our treatment- amazingly so- and I am no exception! More info about what we're being offered can only be a good thing, right? Dx 7/29/2008, 2cm, Stage IIa??, Grade 3, 5/17 nodes, ER-/PR-/HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Difference between ports/piccs etc? SuzyWillKickThis SuzyWillKickThis

Posts.Content: SuzyWillKickThis wrote: Hi all I will be starting chemo in the next few days and want to try and buy a wig or two, but am not very sure where to start. I understand that there's a huge variety out there, so wondered if anyone can recommend their favourite brand(s) so I can do more research?  Any tips for making them feel comfortable? Also any other tips would be appreciated! My scalp with hair is very dry- will this get worse or better with no hair? Sorry if this isn't going in the right section, I couldn't think where to put it and am new here! :-) Dx 7/29/2008, 2cm, Stage IIa??, Grade 3, 5/17 nodes, ER-/PR-/HER2- Log in to post a reply
